definition: to raise one's head/to perk up
abbr. for 揚州|扬州[Yang2 zhou1]/surname Yang
to raise/to hoist/the action of tossing or winnowing/scattering (in the wind)/to flutter/to propagate
variant of 揚|扬[yang2]

to rise/to raise/to get up/to set out/to start/to appear/to launch/to initiate (action)/to draft/to establish/to get (from a depot or counter)/verb suffix, to start/starting from (a time, place, price etc)/classifier for occurrences or unpredictable events: case, instance/classifier for groups: batch, group

sentences.english: I asked the strange boy, raising my eyebrows in curiosity.
sentences.chinese: 我好奇地扬起眉毛问这个奇怪的年轻人。

sentences.english: She held her head high as a small trickle of blood ran down from her bruised knee.
sentences.chinese: 她高高扬起头，青肿的膝盖上一滴血慢慢流下来。

sentences.english: When a spoiler is raised, the wing on that side drops.
sentences.chinese: 当一个扰流片扬起的时候，另一边的机翼就会下降。

sentences.english: The car caused a cloud of dust as it went down the dirt road.
sentences.chinese: 小车沿着布满灰土公路飞驰，扬起了漫天灰尘。

sentences.english: The horse perked up its head when i shouted .
sentences.chinese: 我吆喝时那马扬起了头。

sentences.english: He couldn't be careful enough on that upstroke.
sentences.chinese: 他扬起翅膀时，真是够小心的了。

sentences.english: Yo ho, haul together, hoist the Colors high.
sentences.chinese: 唷吼，一起转航，扬起船旗。

sentences.english: The courses and top sails are set.
sentences.chinese: 下桁大横帆和中桅帆均已扬起。

sentences.english: The camels rolled in the white dust, raising puffs of cloud.
sentences.chinese: 骆驼在白茫茫的沙里打滚，扬起阵阵尘雾。

sentences.english: Bullets ripped into the sandbags of the guard tower, kicking up puffs of sand.
sentences.chinese: 子弹撕开警卫塔下的沙袋，扬起串串沙尘。

sentences.english: " Fleur invited me, "said Krum, eyebrows raised.
sentences.chinese: “是芙蓉邀请我的”克鲁姆扬起眉毛说。

sentences.english: My heart sit still, do not raise dust.
sentences.chinese: 我的心静静坐着，不要扬起尘土。

sentences.english: Lord Henry elevated his eyebrows and looked at him in amazement.
sentences.chinese: 享利勋爵扬起眉毛，惊奇地瞧着他。

sentences.english: Against whom have you raised your voice and lifted your eyes in pride?
sentences.chinese: 扬起声来，高举眼目攻击谁呢？

sentences.english: When the Emperor saw me, he raised his painted eyebrows and stopped.
sentences.chinese: 当皇帝看见我的时候，他扬起画过的眉毛，停下了。

definition: to lift up
to flit across/to sweep past/to glance (strike at an angle)
to wave sth/to brandish
(of a meteor etc) to streak across (the sky)/(of a searchlight, lightning etc) to play across (the sky)
to roll up/to curl up/(of dust etc) to swirl up
variant of 捲起|卷起[juan3 qi3]
to wave/to brandish/to command/to conduct/to scatter/to disperse
to shake/to fling one's arm/to lash/to swing
to heave/to lift/to raise up/to uphold
to appear/to emerge/to surface
to hang down
corner of the mouth
to float/to emerge
corner of the mouth/labial angle
to stop/to halt/to cease
to stick up/to point sth up
dust
